sync-push.description: Push user-level changes to linked project repos
sync-push.prompt:
I need to push user-level configuration changes to linked project repos with full automation. Please:

1. Read my ~/.claude/settings.json to identify sync groups
2. Read .claude/sync-manifest.json in this repo to understand current state
3. Compare versions and detect changes
4. Show me which linked repos will receive updates AND ASK FOR APPROVAL:
   - List each repo that will get worktrees created
   - Show what changes will be made to each
   - Ask: 'Create worktrees and push to these repos? [Yes to all] [Select specific] [Cancel]'
   - Wait for user confirmation before proceeding
5. CHECK SSH SETUP (CRITICAL - refer to automation/ssh-setup in XML docs):
   a. Test if SSH keys exist: ls ~/.ssh/id_ed25519*
   b. Test if SSH works: ssh -T git@github.com
   c. If keys missing: Generate with ssh-keygen -t ed25519
   d. If keys exist but not added to GitHub: Show public key and wait for user to add it
   e. Test git remote uses SSH: git remote get-url origin
   f. If HTTPS: Convert to SSH format
6. CHECK GH CLI (for automatic PR creation):
   a. Test if gh installed: which gh
   b. If not installed: Prompt user to install (brew install gh)
   c. Test if authenticated: gh auth status
   d. If not authenticated: Run gh auth login
7. For each repo:
   - Create or switch to sync worktree (pattern: {repo-name}-sync)
   - Update .claude/settings.json in worktree
   - Update sync-manifest.json with new version, changelog, timestamp
   - Commit with message: 'sync: Update {group-name} v{version} by {author} - {changes}'
   - Push branch to remote
   - AUTOMATICALLY CREATE PR using gh pr create with detailed description (see pr-template in XML)
   - Capture PR URL from output
8. Display summary with clickable PR links:
   âœ… Sync complete! Pushed to N repos:
   - repo-1: [PR URL]
   - repo-2: [PR URL]

Refer to .claude/docs/INTERNAL-INSTALL-HELPER.xml automation section for complete SSH setup flow and PR template.

copy-write.description: Generate copy using master copywriting system with optimized pass workflow
copy-write.prompt:
I need to write copy. Read .claude/skills/master-copywriting/SKILL.md and .claude/skills/master-copywriting/GLOBAL_BEHAVIOR.md.

## OPTIMIZED WORKFLOW (Credit-Efficient)

### Phase 1: Intake
1. Ask what type of copy (listicle, blog, ad, email, landing page)
2. Gather topic/offer details and target audience
3. Quick competitive scan (3-5 examples, not 10)

### Phase 2: Draft + Passes 1-2 (Combined)
Draft the copy while simultaneously checking:
- Pass 1: Structure (all sections present, logical flow)
- Pass 2: Value (every paragraph teaches something)
Apply fixes inline as you draft.

### Phase 3: Pass 3 Deep Dive (AI Pattern Removal)
Focused pass on AI tells:
- Count em dashes (fix if >2)
- Search for cliche phrases and remove
- Check sentence start variety
- Read-aloud test for robotic tone
Show the cleaned copy.

### Phase 4: PAUSE FOR PREVIEW
STOP HERE and tell user:
'Copy is ready for preview. I'll show it in a format you can review visually.

Options:
[A] Looks good - continue to passes 4-7
[B] Feedback first - tell me what to fix, then continue passes
[C] Good enough - skip remaining passes, use as-is for testing'

### Phase 5: Passes 4-7 (If User Chooses A or B)
Only run if requested:
- Pass 4: Human Voice (conversational check)
- Pass 5: Competitive (better than alternatives?)
- Pass 6: Emotional (creates feeling?)
- Pass 7: Mobile (scannable?)

### Value Capture
Any feedback given during this process - automatically extract the VALUE LESSON and add to .claude/skills/master-copywriting/SELF_HEALING.md with HEALING_UPDATE markers.

For listicles: also read .claude/skills/master-copywriting/workflows/write-listicle-copy.md

copy-feedback.description: Log feedback to improve the copywriting system (self-healing)
copy-feedback.prompt:
I have feedback to improve the copywriting system. Read .claude/skills/master-copywriting/SELF_HEALING.md.

## FEEDBACK PROCESS

### Step 1: Gather Feedback
Ask: 'What didn't work or needs improvement?'

### Step 2: Extract VALUE LESSON
From the feedback, identify:
- The specific issue
- Why it happened (gap in system)
- The lesson learned
- How to prevent it next time

### Step 3: Categorize
- AI Patterns / Length-Format / Tone-Voice / Missing Elements / False Positives

### Step 4: Propose Fix
Show exactly:
- Which file to update
- What to add (the VALUE LESSON)
- The HEALING_UPDATE markers that will wrap it

### Step 5: Apply (Auto-Approved)
Unless user says stop:
- Add the fix with HEALING_UPDATE markers including date
- Add entry to HEALING_LOG section
- Confirm: 'Value lesson captured. Future copy will be better.'

### VALUE LESSON FORMAT
```
<!-- HEALING_UPDATE
Date: [today]
Issue: [what went wrong]
Lesson: [what we learned]
Source: User feedback
-->
[The actual improvement/rule/example]
<!-- /HEALING_UPDATE -->
```

copy-help.description: Show all copywriting commands, system overview, and next steps
copy-help.prompt:
Show the complete copywriting system help. Read .claude/skills/master-copywriting.md and display:

## MASTER COPYWRITING SYSTEM

### Available Commands
| Command | What It Does |
|---------|-------------|
| /copy-write | Generate new copy with optimized 7-pass workflow |
| /copy-check | Review existing copy with scorecard |
| /copy-feedback | Log feedback to improve the system (self-healing) |
| /copy-help | Show this help |

### How It Works

**Optimized Pass Flow (Credit-Efficient):**
1. Passes 1-2 run together during drafting (Structure + Value)
2. Pass 3 goes deep on AI pattern removal
3. PAUSE for user preview
4. Passes 4-7 only run if user wants more polish

**Automatic Behavior:**
- Light checks apply to all copy/content automatically
- Say 'skip copy checks' to pause
- Say 'full copy review' for deep analysis

**Self-Healing:**
- Every feedback session captures VALUE LESSONS
- Lessons are logged with dates in SELF_HEALING.md
- System gets better with each use

### The 7 Passes (Quick Reference)
1. **Structure** - All sections present, logical flow
2. **Value** - Every paragraph teaches something
3. **AI Patterns** - Em dashes, cliches, robotic tone
4. **Human Voice** - Sounds like a person talking
5. **Competitive** - Better than alternatives
6. **Emotional** - Creates feeling, motivates
7. **Mobile** - Scannable, short paragraphs

### AI Patterns to Avoid
- Em dashes: Max 2 per piece
- Never: 'it's important to note', 'in conclusion', 'let's dive in'
- Watch: excessive hedging, parallel structure overuse

### Next Steps
1. Try `/copy-write` to generate new copy
2. Use `/copy-check` on existing content
3. Give feedback via `/copy-feedback` to improve the system
4. System auto-heals and gets better over time

### Files Location
.claude/skills/master-copywriting/
- SKILL.md (main workflow)
- GLOBAL_BEHAVIOR.md (throttling rules)
- SELF_HEALING.md (feedback log + improvements)
- references/ (formulas, patterns, psychology)
- workflows/ (listicle-specific, etc.)

## SELF-HEALING FRAMEWORK

### Available Commands
| Command | What It Does |
|---------|-------------|
| /heal-log | Log feedback to any skill's healing system |
| /heal-status | Show healing stats across all skills |
| /heal-review | Review recent VALUE LESSONS |
| /heal-create | Create a new self-healing skill |
| /heal-add | Add self-healing to an existing skill |
| /heal-help | Show this help |

### Core Philosophy
**Every skill should get better with use. Feedback is a gift.**

### The Healing Cycle
1. User gives feedback
2. Extract VALUE LESSON
3. Categorize the issue
4. Apply fix with markers
5. Log to audit trail
6. Verify fix works
7. Propagate if universal

### VALUE LESSON Format
```
<!-- HEALING_UPDATE
Date: YYYY-MM-DD
Skill: skill-name
Issue: what went wrong
Lesson: what we learned
Category: category
Source: User feedback
Severity: Critical|Important|Minor
-->
{The actual fix}
<!-- /HEALING_UPDATE -->
```

### Standard Categories
- Output Quality
- Format/Structure
- Tone/Voice
- Logic/Flow
- Missing Elements
- False Positives
- AI Patterns
- Performance

### For Skill Authors
When creating ANY new skill:
1. Use /heal-create to generate from template
2. Include SELF_HEALING.md in your skill
3. Define skill-specific categories
4. Add /{skill}-feedback command
5. Your skill is now self-healing!

### Files Location
.claude/skills/self-healing/
- SKILL.md (workflows)
- CORE.md (patterns)
- AUDIT_LOG.md (history)
- templates/ (for new skills)

listicle-research.prompt:
Research competitors for listicle copy. Read .claude/skills/master-copywriting/listicle-intel/LISTICLE_INTEL.md.

## RESEARCH WORKFLOW

### Step 1: Get Offer Type
Ask: 'What offer type to research?' (e.g., debt-relief, solar, insurance)

### Step 2: Check Existing Intel
Look in listicle-intel/analysis/[offer-type]/
If exists and < 30 days old:
  'I have recent intel for [type]. Use existing? [Yes] [Refresh with Brightdata]'

### Step 3: If Fresh Research Needed
Use Brightdata MCP tools:
1. mcp__brightdata__search_engine - Search '[offer-type] comparison', 'best [offer-type]'
2. mcp__brightdata__scrape_as_markdown - Scrape top 5-10 results

### Step 4: Extract Patterns
From scraped content, identify:
- Headline patterns
- CTA language
- Psychology triggers
- Structure approaches
- Offer positioning

### Step 5: Store Intel
Save to listicle-intel/analysis/[offer-type]/:
- competitors.md (raw analysis)
- patterns.md (extracted patterns)
- psychology.md (triggers used)
- cta-library.md (CTAs that work)

Update OFFER_TYPES.md index.

### Step 6: Confirm
```
Research complete for [offer-type]!

Analyzed: [X] competitors
Patterns extracted: [Y]
CTAs captured: [Z]

Stored in: listicle-intel/analysis/[offer-type]/

```

## WORKFLOW

### Step 1: Get Context

If intel exists for offer type:
- Read listicle-intel/analysis/[offer-type]/patterns.md

Use loaded patterns to:

### Step 4: Apply 7-Pass Review

This workflow uses STORED intel - no Brightdata calls unless explicitly refreshing research.

listicle-help.description: Show listicle intel commands and system overview
listicle-help.prompt:
Show listicle intel help. Read .claude/skills/master-copywriting/listicle-intel/LISTICLE_INTEL.md.

## LISTICLE INTELLIGENCE SYSTEM

### What This Is
A specialized sub-skill within master-copywriting that:
- Uses Brightdata to research competitors
- Stores analyzed patterns for reuse
- Learns from feedback over time
- Saves credits by reusing intel

### Commands
| Command | What It Does | Credit Cost |
|---------|-------------|-------------|
| /listicle-research | Scrape & analyze competitors | Medium (Brightdata) |
| /listicle-write | Write copy using stored intel | Low (no API) |
| /listicle-patterns | Show patterns for offer type | Low (no API) |
| /listicle-cta | Generate CTAs from patterns | Low (no API) |
| /listicle-feedback | Log feedback, heal the intel | Low (no API) |
| /listicle-help | Show this help | Low (no API) |

### How It Works
1. /listicle-research analyzes competitors with Brightdata (one-time cost)
2. Patterns stored in listicle-intel/analysis/[offer-type]/
3. /listicle-write uses stored intel (no additional cost)
4. Feedback improves patterns over time
5. Universal lessons propagate to master-copywriting

### When It Activates
- 'listicle' mentioned in request
- 'comparison content' or 'offer comparison' mentioned
- /listicle-* command invoked
- Working in taches/ directory

### Files
```
listicle-intel/
â”œâ”€â”€ LISTICLE_INTEL.md (this system)
â”œâ”€â”€ OFFER_TYPES.md (index of analyzed offers)
â”œâ”€â”€ SELF_HEALING.md (listicle-specific healing)
â”œâ”€â”€ analysis/ (per-offer intel)
â”œâ”€â”€ patterns/ (cross-offer patterns)
â””â”€â”€ lessons/ (VALUE LESSONS archive)
```

### Credit-Efficient Usage
- First research: Uses Brightdata (necessary cost)
- Subsequent writes: Uses stored intel (free)
- Refresh only when intel > 30 days old

self-healing-auto-detect.description: Automatically detect skills without self-healing and prompt to add
self-healing-auto-detect.content:
## Self-Healing Auto-Detection (ALWAYS ACTIVE)

When ANY skill file is created or modified in .claude/skills/:

### Detection
1. Check if skill directory has SELF_HEALING.md
2. Check if skill has a /{skill}-feedback command
3. If EITHER is missing, this skill is NOT self-healing

### Prompt (Auto-Triggered)
If skill is missing self-healing, IMMEDIATELY ask:
```
ğŸ”§ This skill doesn't have self-healing enabled.

Self-healing helps skills improve over time based on your feedback.
I can auto-generate a custom SELF_HEALING.md for this skill.

Add self-healing? [Yes] [No]
```

### If User Says Yes
1. Analyze the skill's purpose and output type
2. Auto-generate appropriate healing categories
3. Create custom review checklist
4. Create SELF_HEALING.md with all customizations
5. Add /{skill}-feedback command
6. Confirm: 'Self-healing added! The skill will now improve with use.'

### If User Says No
Note in AUDIT_LOG.md and remind again after 3 uses of the skill.

### Key Principle
NO skill should exist without self-healing. Every skill MUST be able to improve.

listicle-intel-conditional.description: Conditionally activate listicle intelligence when listicle work is detected
listicle-intel-conditional.content:
## Listicle Intelligence - Conditional Activation

### ONLY Activate When:
1. User mentions 'listicle' in their request
2. User mentions 'comparison content' or 'offer comparison'
3. User invokes any /listicle-* command
4. User is working on files in taches/ directory
5. User asks about specific offer types (debt-relief, solar, insurance, etc.) in context of copy

### Stay DORMANT When:
- General copywriting (blogs, ads, emails)
- Non-listicle content requests
- Standard /copy-* commands without listicle mention
- Technical/code tasks

### When Activated:
1. Check if intel exists for the offer type
2. If intel exists: 'I have stored intel for [type]. Using it for this copy.'
3. If no intel: 'No stored intel for [type]. Want me to research with Brightdata first? [Yes - Research] [No - Use general patterns]'

### Credit Efficiency Rules:
- NEVER auto-run Brightdata without asking
- ALWAYS check for existing intel first
- Offer to use stored patterns before fresh research
- Note: '/listicle-write' costs almost nothing if intel exists
- Note: '/listicle-research' uses Brightdata (medium cost)

### Cross-Skill Healing:
When a VALUE LESSON from listicle work could help ALL copy:
1. Ask: 'This lesson could improve all copywriting. Propagate? [Yes] [No]'
2. If yes: Add to master-copywriting/SELF_HEALING.md with propagate marker
3. Keep listicle-specific lessons in listicle-intel/SELF_HEALING.md only

### Location:
listicle-intel/ is a MODULE within master-copywriting/, not a separate skill.
It inherits from master-copywriting but adds offer-specific intelligence.
